Render a data.frame in draw_frame form.

Render a data.frame in draw_frame form.

draw_frame(x)

Arguments

x

data.frame (atomic types, with at least 1 row and 1 column).

Value

chracter

See also

build_frame, qchar_frame, char_frame

Examples


tc_name <- "training"
x <- build_frame(
   "measure",                   tc_name, "validation" /
   "minus binary cross entropy",      5, 7            /
   "accuracy",                      0.8, 0.6          )
print(x)
#>                      measure training validation
#> 1 minus binary cross entropy      5.0        7.0
#> 2                   accuracy      0.8        0.6
cat(draw_frame(x))
#> build_frame(
#>    "measure"                   , "training", "validation" /
#>    "minus binary cross entropy", 5.0       , 7.0          /
#>    "accuracy"                  , 0.8       , 0.6          )
